thread.title: President Trump Takes A Shot At Department Store That Dropped His Daughter’s Clothing Line
thread.title_full: President Trump Takes A Shot At Department Store That Dropped His Daughter’s Clothing Line

author: Kaitlan Collins
title: President Trump Takes A Shot At Department Store That Dropped His Daughter’s Clothing Line
text:
TOP 5469061 
President Trump attacked Nordstrom on Twitter Wednesday after the company announced it would no longer sell his daughter’s clothing line. (Photos: Getty Images) 
“My daughter Ivanka has been treated so unfairly by @Nordstrom,” the president tweeted. “She is a great person — always pushing me to do the right thing! Terrible!” My daughter Ivanka has been treated so unfairly by @Nordstrom . She is a great person — always pushing me to do the right thing! Terrible! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 8, 2017 
Last week, Nordstrom — which has nearly 350 stores nationwide — announced it was dropping Ivanka Trump’s clothing and shoe lines from its stock in a decision based on the sales performance of the her brand. (Photo: Alex Wong/Getty Images) 
Some critics suspected the decision to drop her line was because of a weekslong “Grab Your Wallet” campaign that encouraged shoppers to boycott the president and his daughter’s brands. 
The co-founder of the campaign told the New York Times she was “thrilled” about Nordstrom’s decision. 
“I am absolutely thrilled, and I know the vast majority of Grab Your Wallet participants will be as well,” Shannon Coulter said. (RELATED: Nordstrom Cuts Ties With Ivanka Trump’s Fashion Brand)
